channel.title: Is this still "Botting"?
channel.description:
EDIT: TL;DR: I'm using a servo to simulate clicks on runescape. Is this bannable?
Before I start, I want to be clear that I'm basing all of this off of [url=http://services.runescape.com/m=rswiki/en/Macroing_and_third-party_software]Macroing and third party software[/url].
On there, it generally says you can't use software to gain an advantage on the game. So no using literal bots like Pbot or epic (Not saying full names just in case)..
You also can't modify the game client to cheat for you.. That's sort f (Not 100% exactly) what the bots I mentioned above do.. to an extent.
Well.. What if I use this method: [url=http://www.reddit.com/r/runescape/comments/2pnepx/hefin_agility_course_without_moving_mouse/cmyg85y]Hefin agility Course with 1 click[/url]
Along with one of these things: [img]http://www.arduino.cc/en/uploads/Main/ArduinoUno_r2_front450px.jpg[/img] And this: [img height=300]http://www.conrad.com/medias/global/ce/2000_2999/2000/2090/2090/209089_LB_00_FB.EPS_1000.jpg[/img] (Yes, the white things too)
This is the idea (Already tested and etc etc).
I write up a script in the arduino IDE to control the servo. The server moves the white "Arm" (Those plastic things in pic above) down to simulate a mouse click. As it is LITERALLY CLICKING THE MOUSE, there's no way to detect that it's not me inputting the click. The next step is/was to write in delays for each part of the Hefin course. I haven't done this, but the longest part of it is 11 seconds.
Basically, what I'm doing is making a timer for the servo to click (I'ma try and add in a randomized time to the delay, to make it seem more human) on the specified part of the Hefin course. As that one spot makes it possible for me to consistently do laps..
The reason this works, is because I'm on a laptop. While it will work just fine on a desktop, laptops have the mouse buttons that are stationary. So if you do this on a desktop, you will need to find a way to hold the mouse still as your servo will use enough force to slide the mouse, not only preventing it from clicking, but also losing the one click agility spot.
But. Is this "Safe"? Like, could they decide to somehow ban me for running countless laps on the hefin course? I'm not seeing how they would be able to detect that I'm doing this, as I plug the arduino in to my pc only when I'm running the IDE to write code for it, not like they'd even know what I'm using the arduino for. After that it runs on a seperate power supply.. So there's no way to detect that I'm sending "false input". The only thing that could get me in trouble for doing what I'm saying (I BELIEVE) is... This post here. But am I wrong?

item.title: Is this still "Botting"?
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

basically it goes like this
unless youre sitting there burning your actual time on the game its botting

Read full topic

to end this for all time. You’re using some form of automation = botting.

Read full topic

@silabsoft wrote:

requesting autominer splash screen image

Read full topic

item.title: Is this still "Botting"?
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

Because I think that even if you actually played the game legit and kept doing the exact same thing over and over again they could still flag your account as a bot. I don’t know their exact way of doing this but I’m sure they revealed some details as to how they did it when they did the bot nuke thing. Along with that they also said that new bots could circumvent their detection methods and new bot busting methods would be implemented as the bots adapted. This was several years back, I’m pretty sure they’ve got most if not all ways of botting mapped out by now.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this still "Botting"?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Cres, post:40, topic:551983”]their client registers every “click” and either processes it locally or sends the data through to be analyzed. it’s not so much the nature of the “click”, it’s just the clicking patterns and periods/intervals/iterations at which you’re doing the exact same thing over and over and over again that will mark your account as a bot.

edit: I could be wrong and they could be analyzing your packet history and packet content too but either way, you’re going to get banned[/quote]
I’m not understanding how they’d “detect” it being botted vs it being me clicked.
The clicking patterns that I’d be demonstrating using the microcontroller are the exact same clicking patterns that’d be used when I actually run the prif course.
I’ll get the course sometimes as a daily challenge, which requires 20+ runs usually. All I do is set my screen up so I can do the one click run method, and then do it.
The only difference is that there’s a piece of plastic that’s triggered by a semi-random timer clicking, instead of me.

To be clear I’m not saying “It’s not bannable” here. I’m saying, I don’t get how they would register the difference.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this still "Botting"?
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

their client registers every “click” and either processes it locally or sends the data through to be analyzed. it’s not so much the nature of the “click”, it’s just the clicking patterns and periods/intervals/iterations at which you’re doing the exact same thing over and over and over again that will mark your account as a bot.

edit: I could be wrong and they could be analyzing your packet history and packet content too but either way, you’re going to get banned

Read full topic

item.title: Is this still "Botting"?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:34, topic:551983”]op why do you persist
lock this thread now man stop wasting your own time for god sake[/quote]
Hahaha as if there’s anything better to do on these forums.

Cres:

basically, if your bot is succesfull they’ll find out and jaghax is very strict about anything that remotely suggests botting

How would they find out?

Death Style:

just play legit for 16 hours straight and if you get banned we can tell if their system works

I’ve done that one time… But I’d never sit at prif course for 16 hours straight. EVER. Botting/Autoclicking or not.
I can’t stand doing one thing on runescape. I go do dungeoneering, then slayer, then farming, then some other skills, or the tuska event, etc.
Can’t do any quests cause I got a quest cape

Read full topic

item.title: Is this still "Botting"?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Which is definitely legitimate. But not moving your mouse is the fastest way to get flagged for checking, and if you are botting its the fastest way to get banned, outside of the bots that just run non-stop

Read full topic

item.title: Is this still "Botting"?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:31, topic:551983”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=670900.msg4486941#msg4486941 date=1434648781]

It’s not snarky, you’ve continuously made comments in the thread that you think this is somehow better than a software clicker even after whats been said. I’m trying to get it through to you that it’s not. This is actually WORSE than a software one, because those tend to be able to add a bit of randomization to not only timing but also the mouse movement.

It’s better in one, single aspect. That’s it.
And that is: IF jagex used process checks/etc to see if autoclickers or other bot-like programs were running. That’s all.
[/quote]And it was said very early in the thread that they don’t…

[quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=670900.msg4486941#msg4486941 date=1434648781]
I also can add in randomized timers. That isn’t hard.
I wouldn’t need to add in mouse movement, because as stated, the point of the prif course was that I wasn’t moving the mouse.
[/quote]That’s why I said ‘not only timing’, because you actually DO need mouse movement, not only the timers. Not moving the mouse at all is one of the fastest ways to get banned. A real player, even when doing something like the course where you arent moving, will still move the mouse from time to time, even if its on accident.[/quote]
I’ve done the course many times… Before I even thought about using my microcontroller, without moving the mouse a single pixel.
You want to know how that’s possible? I have a laptop.
I set the mouse into position. And then I click the button. I never have to touch my trackpad again, so the mouse doesn’t move again. Whether on purpose or on accident.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this still "Botting"?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:30, topic:551983”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=670900.msg4486940#msg4486940 date=1434648256]
It’s not snarky, you’ve continuously made comments in the thread that you think this is somehow better than a software clicker even after whats been said. I’m trying to get it through to you that it’s not. This is actually WORSE than a software one, because those tend to be able to add a bit of randomization to not only timing but also the mouse movement.
[/quote]
It’s better in one, single aspect. That’s it.
And that is: IF jagex used process checks/etc to see if autoclickers or other bot-like programs were running. That’s all.[/quote]And it was said very early in the thread that they don’t…

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:30, topic:551983”]I also can add in randomized timers. That isn’t hard.
I wouldn’t need to add in mouse movement, because as stated, the point of the prif course was that I wasn’t moving the mouse.[/quote]That’s why I said ‘not only timing’, because you actually DO need mouse movement, not only the timers. Not moving the mouse at all is one of the fastest ways to get banned. A real player, even when doing something like the course where you arent moving, will still move the mouse from time to time, even if its on accident.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this still "Botting"?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Davidi2:

It’s not snarky, you’ve continuously made comments in the thread that you think this is somehow better than a software clicker even after whats been said. I’m trying to get it through to you that it’s not. This is actually WORSE than a software one, because those tend to be able to add a bit of randomization to not only timing but also the mouse movement.

It’s better in one, single aspect. That’s it.
And that is: IF jagex used process checks/etc to see if autoclickers or other bot-like programs were running. That’s all.

I also can add in randomized timers. That isn’t hard.
I wouldn’t need to add in mouse movement, because as stated, the point of the prif course was that I wasn’t moving the mouse.

And we don't know exactly how jagex detects cheaters, they spent a lot of time creating their detection algorithms. We just know it's pretty decent nowadays.
Hence my curiosity.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this still "Botting"?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:

It’s not snarky, you’ve continuously made comments in the thread that you think this is somehow better than a software clicker even after whats been said. I’m trying to get it through to you that it’s not. This is actually WORSE than a software one, because those tend to be able to add a bit of randomization to not only timing but also the mouse movement.

And we don’t know exactly how jagex detects cheaters, they spent a lot of time creating their detection algorithms. We just know it’s pretty decent nowadays.

item.title: Is this still "Botting"?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:27, topic:551983”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=670900.msg4486934#msg4486934 date=1434646791]

Yes, it’s still botting, and you eventually will get banned for a day or 2, and then get rolled back. A friend of mine was doing something similar to this at the seren stones, and was rolled back for 30m mining xp.

What I’m wondering is how they caught him…
[/quote]Seriously… Like I said earlier, there is NO difference between using this and using a software autoclicker when it comes to detection. The only times there would be a difference is when the company actually checks your running processes, like Valve Anti Cheat and stuff like that. Jagex doesn’t have that, so doing something like this is EXACTLY the same as using a software clicker, except more expensive and more likely to fail.[/quote]
Not just saying because they checked software.
I’m wondering if they
A) Noticed he was clicking the exact same pixel for X hours…
B) Noticed his mouse rarely (If at all) moved.
C) Player reports
D) A combination of the above.
So get your snarky attitude out of here.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this still "Botting"?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:26, topic:551983”][quote author=3lv3n snip3r link=topic=670900.msg4486932#msg4486932 date=1434646302]
Yes, it’s still botting, and you eventually will get banned for a day or 2, and then get rolled back. A friend of mine was doing something similar to this at the seren stones, and was rolled back for 30m mining xp.
[/quote]
What I’m wondering is how they caught him…[/quote]Seriously… Like I said earlier, there is NO difference between using this and using a software autoclicker when it comes to detection. The only times there would be a difference is when the company actually checks your running processes, like Valve Anti Cheat and stuff like that. Jagex doesn’t have that, so doing something like this is EXACTLY the same as using a software clicker, except more expensive and more likely to fail.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this still "Botting"?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

3lv3n snip3r:

Yes, it’s still botting, and you eventually will get banned for a day or 2, and then get rolled back. A friend of mine was doing something similar to this at the seren stones, and was rolled back for 30m mining xp.

What I’m wondering is how they caught him…

I’d assume the reason they busted him is because he was around other players… Which means they see him there for 6+ hours.
And like I said, people love to screw with seren stone miners. I’ve seen countless posts about seren stone auto clickers being lured to their death, and then looted.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this still "Botting"?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Soulcist:

You’re using a hardware that is running a type of software. Lmao, why are you trying to think so hard about this and find a loophole xD? They’re going to ban you (should you be caught) simply because you’re causing an unfair advantage.

Because technicalities can be the best thing sometimes.
And I’m hella bored.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this still "Botting"?
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:22, topic:551983”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=670900.msg4486431#msg4486431 date=1434227777]

The first line of their rules page for Third Party Software is pretty spot-on about this…

Software that can be used to gain an unfair advantage in our games may not be used. This includes automation tools, macros, bots, auto-typers and any other tools that circumvent any of our mechanisms designed to automatically log out inactive users.

You as a player, is not moving, clicking, or otherwise messing with the mouse yourself and allowing a third party to do so itself - for you. I’d say that it’d still warrant a ban should you be caught. Are you going to be caught with something like this? I don’t know, maybe you won’t even be looked at in the first place. Their rule, however, is pretty spot-on about it though.

But technically it’s not software I’m using…
I’m using hardware (That has software on it).
[/quote]I can’t tell if you’re trolling or actually mentally disabled

At this point, probably a bit of both.[/quote]
You’re using a hardware that is running a type of software. Lmao, why are you trying to think so hard about this and find a loophole xD? They’re going to ban you (should you be caught) simply because you’re causing an unfair advantage.

Read full topic
